definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to steam/to cook in a steamer/to reheat cold food by steaming it
to distill/to break a liquid substance up into components by boiling

sentences.english: The detonation pressure and velocity for gasoline/ water emulsion is smaller than those for straight-run gasoline.
sentences.chinese: 渗水乳化汽油的爆震压力和速度低于直馏无铅汽油。

sentences.english: It was soon found that the kerosene straight from crude oil was sometimes not very satisfactory.
sentences.chinese: 不久就发现原油中的直馏煤油有时并不使人满意。

sentences.english: Straight-run diesel oil is very prone to emulsification during alkali cleaning.
sentences.chinese: 直馏柴油碱洗时极易发生乳化现象。

definition: fraction (of a distillate)/key (one component part of a distillate)
